title: Flagster @ THD
details: Developed a Feature-Flagging service allowing store-granular manipulation during run time
Worked full-stack using TDD and XP and interacted with product owner to determine optimal design
Deployed to production and is used daily by 2000+ stores in a department that accounts for 8% of firm’s revenue

title: Summer Projects @ Thrivent
details: Wrote Selenium scripts to automate testing, and contributed to PDF-parsing in framework
Trained over 10 experienced Java developers in the Selenium framework
Created a VBA script to search for abnormalities in a 100GB+ file with PPM Data

title: SYNCRUS (Winner at HackGT)
details: We were inspired by the data set provided by NCR to build a data visualization of a store"s best selling departments in different cities across the nation
We also built a simulation of shoppers to analyze the efficiency and shopper-friendly design of the stores locations per city.
We wanted to create a analytical view of the entire lifecycle of selling a product, from warehouse distribution to product placement within each specific store.

title: Gameboy Game: Drone Rebel
details: For CS 2110, created a gameboy game called Drone Rebel in which a drone would roam the screen dropping bombs
The player will have to dodge the bombs while simultaneously shooting bullets back up at the drones

title: LifeMapper
details: Vue application that plots major life events on a Leaflet Map along with a time-line
You are looking at it, right now

title: Day in the Lobby
details: Junior Design Project with the GT College of Computing as our client
Installed raspberry pi cameras in the lobby to count number of people in line to meet recruiters
Developed user-tested UI that enables easy analysis of the data

title: Craigslist Data Mining
details: Grabbed CraigsList data and stored in Excel
Then, cross-referenced car with Kelly Blue Book to find out if car is a good deal or not

title: Expense Report
details: Created an Expense Report that would forecast spending based on current trends, had budgetary capabilities, and had a friendly UI

title: Project Euler
details: A series of challenging mathematical/computer programming problems that will require more than just mathematical insights to solve
Although mathematics will help you arrive at elegant and efficient methods, the use of a computer and programming skills will be required to solve most problems
Solved 65 problems on the site (top 3.532% on the site)

title: LinkedOut
details: Scraping LinkedIn data of GT Alumni, then visualizing the results of various ML algorithms to extract data

title: My Finances
details: Developing a personalized finance website to replace my use of Intuit Mint

title: My Tasks
details: Developing a personalized to-do app that caters to my needs and habits

title: Internship Search Visualization
details: Developing a visualization using D3 and collected data of the timeline of my 2019 summer internship search
